Package camzup.core

Class Complex

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Complex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Complex>
Direct Known Subclasses:
KtComplex
public class Complex extends Object implements Comparable<Complex>
A two-dimensional complex number. The imag component is a coefficient of i, or the square-root of negative one.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Complex.AbstrComparator
    An abstract class that may serve as an umbrella for any custom comparators of complex numbers.

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Complex z)
      Returns -1 when this complex number is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of complex number to be sorted.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Complex>
      Parameters:
      z - the comparisand
      Returns:
      the numeric code

    • toArray

      public float[] toArray(float[] arr, int i)
      Puts the complex number's components into an existing array at the index provided. The real component is assigned to element i; the imaginary component, to element i + 1.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      i - the index
      Returns:
      the array

    • grid

      public static Complex[][] grid(int res)
      Generates a 2D array of complex numbers. Defaults to the coordinate range of [-0.5, 0.5] .
      Parameters:
      res - the resolution
      Returns:
      the array
      See Also:
      • grid(int, int)

    • grid

      public static Complex[][] grid(int cols, int rows)
      Generates a 2D array of complex numbers. The result is in row-major order, but the parameters are supplied in reverse: columns first, then rows. Defaults to the coordinate range of [-0.5, 0.5] .
      Parameters:
      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows
      Returns:
      the array
      See Also:
      • grid(int, int, float, float, float, float)

    • grid

      public static Complex[][] grid(int cols, int rows, float lowerBound, float upperBound)
      Generates a 2D array of complex numbers. The result is in row-major order, but the parameters are supplied in reverse: columns first, then rows.
      Parameters:
      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows
      lowerBound - the lower bound
      upperBound - the upper bound
      Returns:
      the array
      See Also:
      • grid(int, int, float, float, float, float)

    • mobius

      public static Complex mobius(Complex a, Complex b, Complex c, Complex d, Complex z, Complex target)
      Performs a Mobius transformation on the variable z. Uses the formula ( a z + b ) / ( c z + d )
      where constants a, b, c, and d satisfy a d - b c 0.0 .
      Parameters:
      a - the a constant
      b - the b constant
      c - the c constant
      d - the d constant
      z - the input complex number
      target - the output complex number
      Returns:
      the Mobius transformation

    • pow

      public static Complex pow(Complex a, Complex b, Complex target, Complex prod, Complex log)
      Raises a complex number to the power of another. Uses the formula

      pow ( a, b ) := exp ( b log ( a ) )

      Discloses the product and log.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output complex number
      prod - the product
      log - the log
      Returns:
      the result
      See Also:
      • exp(Complex, Complex)
      • mul(Complex, Complex, Complex)
      • log(Complex, Complex)
